intro: Torilis arvensis var. purpurea, commonly known as purple fieldweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its flowers are small and white or pale purple, and it produces small, round fruits that are dispersed by wind. The species is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
